snippet: The playwright Daisy Foote says her father, Horton, was her biggest champion, but she couldn’t help indulging in some moments of self-pity as she tried to make her own career.
abstract: Playwright Daisy Foote says her father, Horton, was her biggest champion, but she couldn’t help indulging in some moments of self-pity as she tried to make her own career.
lead_paragraph: The playwright Daisy Foote says her father, Horton, was her biggest champion, but she couldn’t help indulging in some moments of self-pity as she tried to make her own career.

headline.seo: Daisy Foote on Being a Playwright Like Her Father
headline.main: The Pleasure and Pain of Doing Like Dad
headline.print_headline: The Pleasure and Pain of Doing Like Dad
